body:
DeckUtils.loadDeck should deal with errors/exceptions encountered while parsing the deck. Currently any exceptions would lead to the termination of the while program.

Show a message to user that dec file is in an invalid format instead of crashing the program.
author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)
title: handle errors while loading decks

comments.body:
This appears to have been fixed at some point. I have tried to load a dec file that I have deliberately messed up and each time it displays a parse error and refuses to load the deck, which is what you would expect. Tested using 1.44.

**Status:** Fixed
comments.author: [lodici123](https://code.google.com/u/lodici123/)

content:
_From [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/) on May 17, 2012 14:15:19_

DeckUtils.loadDeck should deal with errors/exceptions encountered while parsing the deck. Currently any exceptions would lead to the termination of the while program.

Show a message to user that dec file is in an invalid format instead of crashing the program.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/magarena/issues/detail?id=216_
